Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on an article from a fake news website and there is no credible evidence or official announcement to back up the claim.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the eighth installment of the Fast and Furious franchise, titled The Fate of the Furious, was released in 2017 and starred Vin Diesel, not Justin Bieber.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Justin Bieber will be replacing Paul Walker in the Fast and Furious film series without any valid reasoning or evidence.
Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as an exaggeration as it presents the idea of Justin Bieber taking on a lead role in a popular film series without any substantial basis.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters in terms of credibility and reliability due to its lack of supporting evidence and reliance on a fake news source.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the claim.
